settings.tickets.init.title: Tickets
settings.tickets.init.description: The tickets module allows you to create and manage support requests, helping participants to easily open tickets, and administrators to effectively track and solve them.
settings.tickets.selector.channel: Select the channel where the ticket will be
settings.tickets.selector.category: [OPTIONAL] Select the category where the created tickets will fall
settings.tickets.embeds.description:
The tickets module allows you to create and manage support requests, helping participants to easily open tickets, and administrators to effectively track and solve them.

{info}
settings.tickets.allow_roles.label: Ticket Allowed Roles
settings.tickets.allow_roles.description: Specify the roles that will be able to create tickets.
settings.tickets.allow_roles.dropdown.ad: Select the allowed roles to add
settings.tickets.allow_roles.dropdown.re: Select the allowed roles to delete
settings.tickets.categories.title: Ticket Categories
settings.tickets.categories.description: Select a category to edit or delete.
settings.tickets.categories.dropdown: Select the category you want to change
settings.tickets.categories.modal.label: Label
settings.tickets.categories.modal.title: Ticket Category Item
settings.tickets.channels.title: Channels and ticket categories
settings.tickets.channels.description: Change the categories or channels of the ticket where tickets will be created or transferred
settings.tickets.channels.dropdown.close: Select the closed category where the closed tickets will fall
settings.tickets.channels.dropdown.categ: Select the category where the created tickets will fall
settings.tickets.channels.dropdown.chann: Select the channel where the created tickets will fall
settings.tickets.closed_user.description: Click to prohibit users from closing the ticket.
Click to allow users to close the ticket.
settings.tickets.faq.title: Ticket FAQ
settings.tickets.faq.description: Set up the FAQ and its type.
settings.tickets.faq.dropdown.items: Select the faq you want to change
settings.tickets.faq.modal.label: Label
settings.tickets.faq.dropdown.button.des: You will have 2 FAQ buttons and create ticket.
settings.tickets.faq.dropdown.dropdown.d: Create a ticket through the last item in the drop-down menu with FAQ.
settings.tickets.limit.label: Ticket limit
settings.tickets.limit.description: Change the ticket limit for the user
settings.tickets.limit.title: Tickets Limit
settings.tickets.limit.global_limit.plac: Counts the total number of tickets.
settings.tickets.limit.user_limit.label: Category User Limit
settings.tickets.limit.user_limit.placeh: Counts the number of tickets per category (Default for category)
settings.tickets.limit.invalid: {Emoji.cross} The limit must be an integer number
settings.tickets.messages.label: Ticket Messages
settings.tickets.messages.description: Change the standard messages to your own
settings.tickets.messages.dropdown: Select the message you want to change
settings.tickets.mod_roles.label: Ticket Moderation Roles
settings.tickets.mod_roles.description: Assign moderators to automatically add to all applications.
settings.tickets.mod_roles.dropdown.remo: Select the moderator roles to delete
settings.tickets.name.label: Ticket name
settings.tickets.name.description: Change the default ticket name when opening
settings.tickets.name.modal.title: Tickets Name
settings.tickets.name.modal.label: Name
settings.tickets.type.label: Ticket Type
settings.tickets.type.description: Specifies the preferred way to create a request: through a channel or through a thread.
settings.tickets.type.dropdown.channel.d: A channel is created with access for the moderator and participant.
settings.tickets.type.dropdown.thread.de: A thread is created, to which moderators and participants are added.
settings.tickets.modals.label: Ticket Forms
settings.tickets.modals.description: Set up the forms and its type.
settings.tickets.modals.embed.title: Ticket #{index}
settings.tickets.modals.embed.descriptio: The tickets module allows you to create and manage support requests, helping participants to easily open tickets, and administrators to effectively track and solve them.
settings.tickets.modals.dropdown.style.p: Displays the paragraph style of the form.
settings.tickets.modals.dropdown.style.s: Indicates the short style of the form.
settings.tickets.modals.dropdown.style.p: Specify the short or paragraph form style
settings.tickets.modals.dropdown.require: The user will need to enter the data in the field.
The user can optionally enter data in the field.
Specify whether the data is required for the form.
settings.tickets.modals.dropdown.forms: Select the form to edit or delete.
settings.tickets.modals.modal.label: Label
settings.tickets.modals.info.label: — Label:
